result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Andrew Lange

defendant.name: Lange, William Andrew
defendant.address: 417 West Dewey Street, Cuba City, WI 53807

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Motion to Modify Bond - Mr. Lange
Supplement to Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 001844,
Payable Number: 67631,
Receipt Number: 22R 003312,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall be in compliance with the restraining order in Lafayette County Circuit Court Case 22-CV-32.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victim 1 or her residence (within 1000 yards).  Contact includes: contact at petitioner home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.
Defendant shall not have any contact with Hi Vibe Fitness
Defendant shall exchange children at the babysitter's residence or the Quick Trip located at 430 S. Water Street, Platteville, WI.  The Parties shall not speak to each other during the exchange.

11:47 AM Defendant William Andrew Lange appeared by video.  Attorney Jenna L Gill appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Allison Markoski appeared in person for defendant.

Atty Markoski acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CF98 and 22CM80 and waives reading.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint in 22CF98; defendant is served with complaint in 22CM80 and reviews the same.

Court has reviewed complaint in both cases and finds probable cause is stated.

State requests $10,000 cash bail in 22CF98 with conditions: 
- no contact with victim or residence
- no contact with Hi Vibe Fitness

State requests $2,000 cash bail in 22CM80 with same conditions in the CF case.

Atty Markoski requests signature bond in both cases and gives argument.  Does not object to request defendant to comply with injunction already in place.

Response by D.A. Gill.

Court orders:

22CF98 - $5,000.00 cash bail with condition:  compliance with restraining order - no contact with victim 1 or residence (within 1000 yards), no contact with Hi Vibe Fitness.
Set for preliminary hearing 10/19/22 at 2:30 p.m.
Atty Markoski waives any time limits.

22CM80 - $1,000.00 cash bail with condition:  compliance with restraining order - no contact with victim 1 or residence (within 1000 Yards), no contact with Hi Vibe Fitness.
Set for status conference 10/19/22 at 2:30 p.m.

Atty Markoski requests parties be allowed to exchange children in a public place and allow contact within 1000 feet during that exchange.
Further discussion re: exchange of children.

Court orders: exchange of children can take place at the babysitter's or the Platteville Quick Trip on 430 S. Water Street, Platteville.  Parties shall not speak to each other during the exchange.

Atty Markoski requests there be an exception for incidental contact.
